details.content:
Are you an expert in the housing industry? Do you have a keen interest in open data? Perhaps your expertise is in open data and your interest is in the housing sector – the Open Data Institute and Nesta are pleased to announce an opportunity that might just be right up your street (so to speak).

The Open Data Institute seeks a Challenge Champion Associate to support the development and delivery of the forthcoming Housing Challenge over the next 8 months and to undertake some key deliverables alongside the Open Data Challenge Series team.

The Challenge Champion will work with us to support the challenge definition process, to cultivate a community of potential participants for the challenge, and will work to raise awareness of the challenge and datasets in the sector. The Challenge Champion is likely to have good networks and experience in housing and/or open data.

This assignment is designed for those currently in part time employment, those looking for something extracurricular or those with a portfolio career. For more on the role, check out the role description below.

This challenge is one part of a collaborative project between Nesta and The Open Data Institute to deliver The Open Data Challenge Series. This 18-month programme is a series of seven challenge prizes designed to generate innovative and sustainable open data solutions to social challenges.

So far we have completed one Challenge on Crime & Justice with the winner being Check that Bike, an organisation using open data from the police to help people check whether the second hand bike they’re buying is stolen. We are currently supporting six finalists from our Education and Energy and Environment challenges with winners to be announced in June.

The Housing Challenge is in the early stages of development and will culminate with the Creation weekend where 15 selected teams will compete to win £5000 initial seed funding and incubation support as finalists. Ultimately, we will select a final winner in December 2014. We are currently working to:

  • engage a range of stakeholders to help us define our specific challenge

  • explore the relevant datasets

  • bring that data to life for our future challenge participants

If you are interested in supporting the team and undertaking the opportunity of the Challenge Champion Assignment, please take a look at the role description below and submit your expression of interest by COP Wed 14 May.
